intro: Geblera, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The flowers are typically small and clustered, often in shades of pink, red, or purple. Geblera species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are often grown as ornamental plants due to their attractive foliage and showy blooms.
